page.title: 12Bondleigh R.Taw pollution
page.content: {Pollution}seeping into the river over the last{20 years}is causing concern; whilst watch is kept on{waste}from {farm fertilizers, silage pits,}and local{Cheese Factory,}wild life has suffered. Ten years ago, a cob wall of silage pit at S.Tawton (15-20 miles upstream), collapsed disgorging contents into Taw, destroying fish and water insect life. The{Water Board}are permitted to extract from river and the general {water level}has consequently{dropped.} {Deterioration}has been noted by local conversationist;{Salmon}can no longer be seen leaping and spawning in the Bondleigh area,{Otters, Kingfishers, } {Dippers}largely{disappeared;}stones in river show a level of dried algae. Trout and Salmon in particular are declining; pollution considered to be a factor causing the decline.
